required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Heart Rate Variability and Postoperative Nausea Vomiting
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Propofol and Sevoflurane on Postoperative Heart Rate Variability and Postoperative Nausea Vomiting

brief_summary.textblock: Propofol and sevoflurane have different effects on heart rate variability. It has not yet been reported whether this difference in effect remains at recovery time after anesthesia and the difference is related to postoperative nausea and vomiting has not been studied. The aim of this study is observe whether propofol and sevoflurane have different effects on heart rate variability during recovery and the differences can predict the occurrence of postoperative nausea and vomiting.

detailed_description.textblock:
Different types of anesthetics have different effects on heart rate variability. However It has not yet been reported whether this difference in effect remains at recovery time after anesthesia.
Several studies have been reported that preoperative heart rate variability predicted the occurence of postoperative nausea and vomiting. However, whether the difference in heart rate variability after anesthesia is related to the difference in postoperative nausea and vomiting has not been studied. Therefore, this study aims to observe whether propofol and sevoflurane have differences during recovery period after anesthesia in heart rate variabiliy. In addition, we want to examine that these differences during recovery period in heart rate variability can predict the occurrence of nausea and vomiting within 24 hours after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: heart rate variability in recovery room
primary_outcome.description: Postoperative heart rate variability measuring at recovery room Frequency domain result: total power, low frequency power, high frequency power, Low frequency/high frequency power ratio

secondary_outcome.description: Q1. Have you vomited or had dry-retching? 0. No Once twice 3 or more times Q2. Have you experienced a feeling of nausea? If yes, has your feeling of nausea interfered with activities of daily living? 0. not at all Sometimes often or most of the time All of the time Add the numerical responses to questions 1 and 2. (total score 0~6)

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting
Patient's satisfaction about postoperative nausea and vomiting

study_pop.textblock: 20~50 years old female patients who scheduled breast surgery under general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Scheduled breast surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Arrhythmia
- Uncooperative with the measuring heart rate variability
- Diabetes
- Hypertension on medication
- Patients taking psychiatric drugs
- Thyroid disease

eligibility.gender_description: Include only mathces self-representation of gender identity and biological sex

patient_data.ipd_description: We will provide it upon the reasonable personal request.
